title: Why many Venezuelans are celebrating US capture of Nicolas Maduro | The World | ABC News
description: During Nicolas Maduro's time in power, Venezuela's economy effectively collapsed under the weight of hyper-inflation, chronic shortages and human rights abuses. Maduro's tenure also saw millions leave the country, including Santiago Vidal Calvo, who lives in Texas and is the Cities Policy Analyst at the Manhattan Institute. title: Adelaide, Melbourne forecast to hit 42 degrees as southern Australia swelters | ABC NEWS
description: Southern Australia is facing severe to extreme heatwave conditions with temperatures in Adelaide and Melbourne forecast to hit maximums of 42 degrees.  Many parts of inland Australia are bracing for maximum temperatures of at least 45 degrees, as hot, dry and windy conditions elevate fire danger across parts of Victoria and South Australia.  The Bureau of Meteorology‚Äôs Sarah Scully says potential thunderstorms threaten to elevate bushfire risk. title: Yemen's civil war leaves Australian tourists stranded on Indian Ocean island | ABC NEWS
description: Clashes between Saudi and Emirati-backed forces in Yemen‚Äôs civil war have left more than 400 tourists stranded on a remote island in the Indian Ocean.  Australians are among the affected foreigners scrambling to book spots on repatriation flights from Socotra through Saudi Arabia.  The current crisis broke out when Riyadh launched air strikes against the Southern Transition Council (STC) in support of Yemeni government forces.  The Department of Foreign Affairs is warning Australian passport holders against travelling to Yemen including Socotra. title: Key freight routes impacted after train derailment in South Australia | ABC NEWS
description: Key freight services connecting the country have been affected after several train wagons derailed between Port Augusta and Port Pirie in South Australia. The incident has left the railway line out of service, affecting all freight routes running from Sydney to Perth, Melbourne to Perth, and Adelaide to Darwin. title: Skiers form heart to honour 40 killed in Swiss bar fire | ABC NEWS
description: The tribute unfolded on the Bellalui slope, famous for hosting men‚Äôs World Cup downhill starts, and honoured the victims of the fire, which also injured more than 100 people.  The event was organised by the Swiss Ski School of Crans-Montana with local ski clubs and backed by Crans-Montana Tourism & Congress.  All 40 people who died in the New Year's Eve bar fire in Switzerland have been identified, with teenagers making up more than half of the death toll.  Swiss authorities have opened a criminal investigation of two bar managers on suspicion of offences including homicide by negligence. title: US weighs military takeover of Greenland | ABC NEWS
description: The White House says it is considering options including military action to annex Greenland, as the US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro stoked fears of another US attack on foreign soil.  White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt says US President Donald Trump sees obtaining Greenland as a ‚Äònecessary security priority‚Äô.  Trump confidant Stephen Miller claims Greenland is an ‚Äòillegitimate‚Äô part of Denmark and his wife Katie Miller recently posted a map on social media showing Greenland as a US territory.  Major European powers such as the UK, France, Germany, Italy, Poland, Spain have rallied behind Greenland and reaffirmed the right of its citizens to determine the future of the Arctic island.  Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen has warned any military attack on the Danish territory would spell the end of NATO.  ABC Americas Editor John Lyons says the future of the defence pact is ‚Äòin danger‚Äô.
